title: Annoying Doesn't Always Mean Broken
body:
I think when it comes down to it, we call champions "broken", "overpowered", or "overloaded" because they're so annoying to fight. Just because a champion is annoying, doesn't mean they're actually powerful, but there is always the possibility of that. Even if a champion isn't overpowered or anything, being unfun to fight is just as big a problem. People play this game for fun, right? It's hard to have fun when fighting an annoying champion, like for me I have to say that {{champion:157}}, {{champion:51}}, and {{champion:67}} are all very annoying champions to fight. And while I tend not to think of the champions as overpowered, I think they should have changes to be less annoying for those fighting them. Even if it's fun or flashy or $LCSBIGPLAYS$ for one person, doesn't mean it's fun for the other.

What I'm trying to get at is that the community should know when a champion is actually broken, or if they're just annoying. And for Riot too, so they know that they don't necessarily have to nerf a champion that's annoying, but change their kit to be less annoying through mini-reworks like {{champion:102}} and {{champion:12}}. (OK, maybe Shyv was a bad example of being less annoying, but the point still stands)

There is actually a difference between broken, OP, and annoying.

Singed is Annoying. He proxies, he is sliperry, and he is fast as fuck. But you can outplay him and he gets stat checked by many champions.

Cammile is (or was prior to the nerfs) OP. She has an overloaded kit and overtuned numbers. It's hard to outplay her and in most cases, even if she messes up, she can beat you through stat checks.

Aatrox, Azir, and Kalista are Broken. Their kits can never be un-gutted or they become extremely overbearing and opressive, each of them for different reasons.

Broken is when you can have a complete monkey and win easily, or when everyone is played at maximum potential, that said champion will crowd out everyone else in terms of power.

Otherwise your points are pretty fair, but I'm pretty sure Caitlyn is OP right now, not just "annoying".

> Otherwise your points are pretty fair, but I'm pretty sure Caitlyn is OP right now, not just "annoying".

I wasn't meaning to say Caitlyn wasn't OP, but I can see how it would come across that way. I was just referring the the champions that I get annoyed with, and I know sure as hell that Caitlyn is powerful right now.

It is very important that something is broken when it is not working as it really should. 

Ex: {{champion:3}} is a broken champion. His kit doesn't have good synergy with itself and his gameplay is very low quality against a lot of the other roster. Normally a low quality kit is fine, but it needs to work together like {{champion:86}}.

{{champion:107}} is currently a broken champion because he is an assassin that can effectively build as an off tank bruiser and still one shot as an assassin while being able to be immune to CC, hence why riot is removing the immunity from him.

{{champion:13}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:41}} are annoying champions because their kits flow very well within themselves and have very good synergy and a high level of quality play. The only real argument I can see is Riven's animation canceling being broken, but riot has stated the like it on her.

Higher damage than is reasonable without being ahead is not a reason for something to be broken, it is simply that champion being grossly over powered.
